title: AI RevOps
description: The AI RevOps lead will architect, automate, and optimise a unified, data-driven commercial operations ecosystem. Leveraging AI and low-code/no-code platforms, you'll transform siloed sales, marketing, support, and customer-success signals into real-time, ROI-driven insights at scale. Tactiq is a rapidly growing global Series A SaaS startup headquartered in Sydney, that uses generative AI to extract actionable knowledge from conversations.
requirements: Deep commercial operations experience in SaaS
Proficiency with sales-enrichment AI (Apollo AI, LinkedIn Navigator, etc.) and orchestration tools
Hands-on with HubSpot, Mixpanel and reporting frameworks
Translates data insights into visual workflows
Bridges technical and business audiences
Track record of stakeholder alignment and iterative delivery
Comfortable with low-/no-code automation, AI and data-integration platforms
Basic understanding of APIs, webhooks, integration and developer collaboration
Familiarity with BI/reporting frameworks and data-quality best practices

companyInfo.description: Tactiq is a rapidly growing global Series A SaaS startup headquartered in Sydney, that uses generative AI to extract actionable knowledge from conversations. Our mission is to transform how teams capture and utilise conversational insights to drive productivity and innovation.

matchReason: The job title 'AI RevOps' at Tactiq in Australia partially aligns with the candidate's profile and search criteria. The candidate is targeting presales roles in artificial intelligence, which suggests a focus on sales engineering rather than RevOps. However, there are overlapping skills and experiences that could be relevant. The candidate's interest in AI aligns with the job's requirement for leveraging AI and low-code/no-code platforms. Additionally, the candidate's potential experience with sales-enrichment AI tools and data integration could be beneficial for the role. However, the job's emphasis on deep commercial operations experience in SaaS, proficiency with specific tools like HubSpot and Mixpanel, and a focus on stakeholder alignment and iterative delivery may not align with the candidate's presales focus. The location matches the candidate's expected location, which is a positive factor. Overall, while there are some relevant skills, the role's focus on RevOps and specific requirements diverge from the candidate's primary interest in presales roles, resulting in a moderate match score.

title: AI Sales Specialist Manager, Google Cloud
description: The AI Sales Specialist Manager at Google Cloud will empower organizations to adopt Google Cloud's AI solutions, demonstrating how AI tools can enhance operations. The role involves collaborating with sales, guiding AI capabilities, and acting as a liaison with product management and engineering. Responsibilities include building executive relationships, executing Go-To-Market strategies, and supporting teams in identifying AI use cases.
requirements: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
12 years of experience in a sales role in the enterprise software or cloud space
Experience with leading and scaling teams in a cloud-based PaaS and SaaS environment
Experience in working with engineers and customer technical leads to build business cases
Experience in promoting cloud-based IT solutions to companies
Experience in promoting business intelligence technologies to clients
Experience in working with managing partners in implementation projects
Experience in working with product teams to embed technology into a product set
Experience in promoting AI technology stack
Knowledge of Google Cloud and Google Cloud AI offerings
Ability to engage and collaborate with executive stakeholders

companyInfo.industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet
companyInfo.description: Google is a leading technology company that provides a variety of internet-related services and products.

title: AI Solutions Engineer
description: We’re looking for a skilled and future-focused AI Solutions Engineer to join our team in Perth CBD. In this role, you'll design, build, and deploy AI-driven solutions focused on intelligent automation and agent-based workflows. You'll work closely with stakeholders to understand real business needs and turn them into scalable, practical applications — helping us drive smarter operations across the company.
requirements: Tertiary degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or related field
Proven experience building and deploying AI/ML applications
Hands-on experience with agent-based systems and conversational AI
Strong Python skills and familiarity with libraries like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn
Experience with workflow automation tools (e.g. Zapier, Integromat, or similar)
Ability to analyse complex processes and design automation strategies
Results-focused mindset with the flexibility to adapt to changing business priorities
Passion for AI and its role in transforming industries

companyInfo.description: APD Global has been delivering advanced, specialised engineering solutions across Power Systems, Telecommunications, and Renewable Energy for over 25 years.

benefits: Work on transformational projects across sectors and borders
Be part of a growing global company with exciting expansion ahead
Real opportunities to grow your career and shape the future of engineering

title: Ubuntu Sales Engineer (Entry-Level)
description: Canonical is hiring an Ubuntu Pro Sales Engineer to help global companies embrace the latest Linux and open source applications. The role involves facilitating the adoption of Ubuntu Pro, OpenStack, and Canonical Microcloud, among others. It is suited for candidates with a technical background who are business-minded and driven by commercial success. The position is part of the global Field Engineering team and involves working closely with enterprise sales leads.
requirements: Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
Demonstrated personal interest in continuous learning and development
Practical knowledge of Linux, virtualisation, containers and networking
Business-minded technology thinker and problem solver
Knowledge of cloud computing concepts & leaders, such as Kubernetes, AWS, Azure, GCP
Interest in large-scale enterprise open source - private clouds, machine learning and AI, data and analytics
Intermediate level Python programming skills
Passion for technology evidenced by personal projects and initiatives
Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
Ability to travel internationally, for company events up to two weeks long, and customer or industry meetings

companyInfo.description: Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with most colleagues working from home.

benefits: Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events
